references.paper_title: A unifying theory of distance from calibration
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for the calibration measures used in the main paper, including the rigorous framework for measuring distances to calibration and the introduction of the smooth calibration error.

references.paper_title: On calibration of modern neural networks
references.reason: This paper is a seminal work that spurred renewed interest in calibration in machine learning by observing that many modern deep learning models are far from calibrated.

references.paper_title: Solving linear programs in the current matrix multiplication time
references.reason: This paper provides the state-of-the-art runtime for solving linear programs, which is relevant to the runtime analysis of algorithms for measuring calibration in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Maximum flow and minimum-cost flow in almost-linear time
references.reason: This paper provides a nearly-linear time algorithm for solving the minimum-cost flow problem, which is used in the main paper to develop a custom solver for computing the smooth calibration error.

references.paper_title: Nested dissection meets ipms: Planar min-cost flow in nearly-linear time
references.reason: This paper presents a nearly linear time algorithm for planar minimum-cost flow, providing a theoretical improvement to the runtime of algorithms for measuring calibration.
